现代数学中丰富、深刻、漂亮的结果大都限于有限维欧式空间及其子空间或其上的函数空间。其本质原因在于有限维空间中有性质几近完美的Lebesgue测度。但在无穷维情形，自Kolmogorov、Wiener和Gelfand等数学大师的工作至今仍未找到Lebesgue测度的替代品即一个性质非常好的测度，使得人们可以深入开展无穷维空间上的分析学研究。可以说，泛函分析大体上相当于无穷维空间的线性代数部分，而对应的无穷维空间的微积分部分很可能还需要未来几代甚至很多代数学家的努力才能完善。
著名数学家M. Atiyah曾断言，二十一世纪的数学将是无穷维数学。将来数学研究的主要对象，必然是无穷维空间；传统的有限维空间只是其特殊情形（尽管在许多情况下它是最重要的情形）。无穷维数学有广泛的应用背景，如量子场论、随机过程、控制论等，且还将迅速扩大。可以预期，无穷维数学必将蓬勃发展，年轻一代数学家将在其中大有所为。与有限维情形类似，无穷维数学的核心和基础是无穷维分析。
本课程将简明扼要地讲授无穷维分析的基础理论和方法；首先讲解无穷维空间中以Kolmogorov定理为主的构造测度的基本办法；其次介绍Wiener测度，这是无穷维空间中第一个非平凡测度的例子；接着引入Hilbert空间中的高斯测度，以及抽象Wiener空间；最后，以抽象Wiener空间为基础较为深入地研究一些分析问题。

复变函数就是自变量为复数的函数。复变函数论是分析学的一个重要分支，又称为复分析。由于某些方程出现负数开平方的情形，为处理类似问题，我们需要扩大数系，引入虚数及复数域。复数理论较系统的叙述是由瑞士数学家欧拉给出的。他首次引入符号i作为虚数的单位，创立了复变函数论的一些基本定理。19世纪，经过柯西，黎曼，魏尔斯特拉斯等著名数学家的努力，复变函数论已形成了非常系统的理论，并与许多数学分支相互影响。20世纪以来，复变函数论不仅在理论研究方面出现了若干崭新的分支和方向，而且它已广泛应用到理论物理和天体力学等方面。

通过讲解天体力学中的N-体问题使学生更加热爱数学。
天体力学中的N-体问题具有很长的历史，它始于1687年牛顿的巨著“原理”。自那以后，许多著名的数学家，天文学家和物理学家对于理解它做出了有价值的贡献。受益于该问题，他们发展了现在用在很多数学领域的经典数学工具。其中 Laplace 和 Lagrange使用过的扰动法帮助 Adams 和Leverrie发现了海王星，Poincaré将变分方法引入天体力学。近20年由于变分方法及对广义解的作用积分的上下界估计与扰动方法的巨大成功使得我们可以获得具有弱力势的多体问题的新轨道。但仍有许多基本问题没有解决，如多体问题的所有解的分类和变分刻划，著名的Sarri 猜想,Wintner-Smale猜想，不仅在欧式空间，还有常曲率空间情形。我们的目的是从常微与动力系统，微分几何，非线性泛函分析、群表示论、代数拓扑、代数几何中引进新的方法来研究多体问题的多种解的存在性和性质（尤其是n=3)以及一些应用。前不久由于引力波的直接实验证明，大家对引力有更大兴趣。

如何设计低成本的快速，安全载人登月轨道是一个有待解决的重大理论和实际问题。登月舱的运动轨道与太阳-地球-月球的引力作用有关，它涉及到一个4-体问题,其中地月转移轨道设计最重要。经典轨道设计的优化条件一般是燃料最省原则，但有许多约束条件须考虑，如火箭运载能力，发射窗口要求，发射场经纬度及发射方位角，入轨精度要求，航天器燃料量和航天器的推力系统和推力大小，月球着陆点等等。
     直接转移初步设计方法有Hohmann转移,双椭圆转移，椭圆-双抛物线转移及拼接圆锥曲线法，但都没考虑到摄动力的影响，目前在地月空间内运动的航天器使用的是根据月球影响球进行分段的受摄二体动力学模型，还很粗糙，为了考虑高精度动力学模型，我们需要考虑4体问题。
     “总的来说，国内关于载人登月轨道设计考虑的约束条件都还比较简单，比如仅考虑了近月点高度和环月轨道倾角”。

In this course, we will first define a probability model to represent the future lifetime of a person. Using this model, the student will learn how to calculate the present value of various types of insurance benefits payable on death, and annuity benefits payable as long as the person survives, as well as their annual premiums.Along the way, we will define concepts such as mortality tables, life expectancy, and see the various curves actuaries have used over the years to describe human mortality.After taking this course, the student will be able to build a mortality table using observed mortality rates, and will understand the relationship existing between a life insurance and a life annuity. He will be able to approximate the distribution of the benefits for a portfolio of insurance policies.
Statistical Modeling in Insurance and Finance
Statistical Modeling in Insurance and Finance

In this course, we will study various statistical models used in general insurance (for example automobile or fire insurance) to represent the distribution of the claim amount and also in finance for the return of a stock. We will see various methods to estimate the parameters of the model, their advantages and disadvantages and we will perform hypothesis tests on the model. Numerous numerical examples will be provided. The student will discover new discrete distributions for the frequency ofclaims in insurance and new continuous models used in demography and survival analysis. In finance, the asymmetry and kurtosis of returns and the extreme values observed will lead to models with long tails. Applications in finance such as value-at-risk (VaR, Tvar) will beanalyzed.

三百多年前，牛顿、贝努利证明二体问题的通解正好是古希腊人发现的二次圆锥曲线，但当牛顿试图求解三体问题时，他没能取得成功，“这是一个使他头痛的问题”。N体问题是最著名的科学难题之一，三百多年来一直吸引许多数学家,天文学家和物理学家研究它的解及其应用，已经取得了很多重要的成果。

如何设计低成本的快速，安全载人登月轨道是一个有待解决的重大理论和实际问题。登月舱的运动轨道与太阳-地球-月球的引力作用有关，它涉及到一个4-体问题,其中地月转移轨道设计最重要。经典轨道设计的优化条件一般是燃料最省原则，但有许多约束条件须考虑，如火箭运载能力，发射窗口要求，发射场经纬度及发射方位角，入轨精度要求，航天器燃料量和航天器的推力系统和推力大小，月球着陆点等等。
?  直接转移初步设计方法有Hohmann转移,双椭圆转移，椭圆-双抛物线转移及拼接圆锥曲线法，但都没考虑到摄动力的影响，目前在地月空间内运动的航天器使用的是根据月球影响球进行分段的受摄二体动力学模型，还很粗糙，为了考虑高精度动力学模型，我们需要考虑4体问题。总的来说，国内关于载人登月轨道设计考虑的约束条件都还比较简单，比如仅考虑了近月点高度和环月轨道倾角。

Microeconomic Analysis – Experimental and Computational Approach
Microeconomic Analysis – Experimental and Computational Approach

The aim of this course is to present a new approach to microeconomics analysis which is based on experimental and computational methods. By combining these methods, one can more effective test the economic theory and to analyze the real economic problems. It is a first step towardsthe full introduction of complexity in microeconomic analysis. During the course, the selected microeconomic issues will be presented. Each class is divided into two parts: in the first part students participate in the experiments or they conduct a simulation; in the second part, the economic theory will be questioned / examined based on previously obtained results. Course will presentthe practical implications as well as the theory and software that allows for repeating the experiments, simulations and analysis. Class 1: Introduction to computational and experimental microeconomics. Why we need to introduce complexity into microeconomics? Experimenting with models and experimenting in the laboratory. El Farol bar problem - experiment vs simulation. Presentation of IT tools: labsee.com (experiments on-line), Maxima (Computer Algebra System), R-CRAN (statistic and econometrics), NetLogo (Agent-based -Computational Economics). Class 2: Experiment Smuggler on the archipelago.The trade-off relations as a main carrier of information in the economy. Ricardian model and transaction costs in foreign trade and export. The strength of collective knowledge.Class 3: Experiment Know thyself. Rationality in the economy. Are our actions consistent with the axioms of rational choice? Are the risk and time changing our decisions? Hyperbolic discounting and prospect theory.Class 4: Experiments on the market and its imperfections. How many firms is needed to break the collusion of producers in an oligopolistic market? Bundling or unbundling products. Auctions and price discriminations.
The Conservation of the Modena World Heritage UNESCO site (Italy)
The Conservation of the Modena World Heritage UNESCO site (Italy)

Since the foundation of the Roman settlement in the year 183 BCE, the evolution of the Modena city has been challenged by floods and earthquakes. This dramatic history is revealed by the geoarcheological and architectural analyses of the remains buried by more than 4 m of fluvial sediments, which are testifying a long sequence of floods.The more recent evolution of the urban area is recorded in the Medieval cathedral and bell tower, which are carrying the scares of ancient earthquake that hit the area in 1249, 1474, 1501, 1505, 1660 and 1996.The challenging problems for the restoration of these world heritage UNESCO monuments, which are covered by 21 different type of stones coming in great part from the despoliation of the ancient Roman city, is keeping a balance between anti-seismic reinforcement and preservation of the ancient structures.We will explore the geological, archaeological and architectural scientific information that provide the complete urban evolution of the city in a time span of 2200 years, up to the 5.9 M earthquake that produced significant damage in 2012 and up to the dramatic floods of 2014.Finally, we will compare the Modena example with the evolution of the alluvial plain and the earthquake history of the Chengdu urban area and other parts of China.
